snippet: China, with an 8 percent gain, posted faster growth in exports than the United States. Canada reported a small gain, but other countries showed declines.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column cites statistics showing that global trade slowed in 2012; notes that United States, with 4.5 percent increase in exports, bucked decline trend but that China, which had an 8 percent gain, posted faster growth overall.
lead_paragraph: China, with an 8 percent gain, posted faster growth in exports than the United States. Canada reported a small gain, but other countries showed declines.

headline.print_headline: In World Trade Data, Signs of a Slowdown
headline.seo: In World Trade Data, Signs of a Slowdown
headline.main: In World Trade Data, Signs of a Slowdown
